Message: The user completes the submission of the form
Im am having trouble with the pixel to do content event test
Hi Gary, I'm here to help! Could you please let me know which platform you are using for the pixel integration? For example, are you using Shopify, GTM, or another platform?

Thanks for letting me know, Gary! Here are the steps to troubleshoot your pixel issue on Shopify:
1. Ensure the customer event is correctly configured in Shopify.
2. Test the event in both Shopify and NewsBreak to ensure it triggers correctly.
3. For a complete_payment event, simulate a product purchase to verify the setup.
For more detailed instructions, you can refer to this article: [How to install a NewsBreak Pixel on Shopify](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/18551604763405-How-to-install-a-NewsBreak-Pixel-on-Shopify).
If you continue to experience issues, please contact our support team at adsupport@newsbreak.com.
The first part of the event goes fine.  I simulated a purchase for the test.  It passes the first part.

Got it, Gary. Since the first part of the event passes, let's ensure the custom pixel code is correctly placed on the event page where the user action takes place. Here are some steps to follow:
1. Verify that the base pixel code is added to your landing page URL.
2. Ensure that the custom pixel code is placed on the event page (where the user action takes place).
3. Perform the action that should trigger the pixel again.
If you continue to have issues, please refer to this article for more detailed troubleshooting steps: [Event Tracking Debugging Steps](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/18551604763405-How-to-install-a-NewsBreak-Pixel-on-Shopify).
If you need further assistance, feel free to contact our support team at adsupport@newsbreak.com.
ok.  I have that article and i printed it out.  I'll continue to work it out.  Thank you
You're welcome, Gary! I'm glad you have the article. If you need any further assistance or run into any issues, don't hesitate to reach out. Good luck with your setup!
